Class ModifyProductMenuController

java.lang.Object
dp.pa.controller.BaseController
dp.pa.controller.ModifyProductMenuController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyProductMenuController extends BaseController
The controller for the Modify Product Menu of the GUI.

  • Field Details

    • product

      public static Product product
      The product to be modified

    • currentParts

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> currentParts
      Placeholder list that holds associated parts of a product This list represents the changes made to the associated parts list of the product. In the event of a saved modification, this list becomes the product's new parts list. In the event of a canceled modification, this list is discarded, the product is unchanged.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the parts and associated parts tableviews.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      Parameters:

      resourceBundle - the ResourceBundle

    • OnActionAddPartToProduct

      public void OnActionAddPartToProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Adds a part from the parts tableview to the associated parts tableview. If no part is selected, nothing occurs.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event that triggers the method.

    • OnActionRemovePartFromProduct

      public void OnActionRemovePartFromProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Removes a part from the associated parts tableview. Asks for confirmation of removal via dialog box. If no part is selected, nothing occurs.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event that triggers the method.

    • OnActionSaveProductMainMenu

      public void OnActionSaveProductMainMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      On click of Save button, saves a new product to the Inventory and redirects user to main menu. Retrieves user input from the form to create a new product object. Prevents invalid/empty data input and displays errors via dialog boxes.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event that triggers the method
      Throws:
      IOException - exception

    • OnCancelMainMenu

      public void OnCancelMainMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Cancels any changes and returns to Main Menu
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event that triggers the method
      Throws:
      IOException - exception

    • OnSearchPart

      public void OnSearchPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Searches the products tableView for products matching the user input. User may search via id (integer) or name (string) - if one search fails, the other is attempted. If one result is found, it is highlighted in the table. If multiple results are found, the table is filtered. If no results found, an error message will display.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event that triggers the method.
